critique: The document revokes two executive orders related to the regulation of interstate commerce of petroleum and its products. It replaces them with two new executive orders. The original orders were created to regulate petroleum commerce in accordance with the Act of Congress approved February 22, 1935. The document itself doesn't express a clear ideological tilt. It seems to be an administrative action related to economic regulation. There is no mention of immigration, executive power, federalism, national security, or social inclusion. Therefore, most axes will be scored as neutral. The economic regulation axis will be scored based on the context of the original act, which aimed to regulate interstate commerce in petroleum.
